intro: Antholyza triticea, commonly known as the common antholyza, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its upright, branched stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers with greenish-white petals, typically blooming in early summer. It is native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia and is often found in grassy habitats. Antholyza triticea is primarily valued for its ornamental appeal and its role in ecological systems.
